page.title: 15St. Andrew's Church
page.content: The Rev. Peter Hall showed us round St. Andrew's which is just over 500 years old.On the outside there are some the stones which go back to Mediaeval times.There was also a coffin lid set into the wall and some gargoyles.While the foundations were being dug for the boiler house lots of bones were found. Inside the church we saw the font where babies are Christened. We were shown the church records but they were not complete because the oldest records were stolen. St. Andrew's is the oldest church in Immingham and all the old maps of Immingham we have found show the church.There is a legend that the carving of a man showing his bottom to Killingholme was placed there when the people of Killingholme refused to help with the building of St.Andrew's. (By Claire Turner and Katy Vollans)
